answers.answer: sounds like no matter what the test says you will eventually lose your thyroid.  The hurthle cells are a concern as noted in your results, but the nodules are very small. They usually don't even test them until they are at least 1 cm, but due to your history they are being dilligent.  Follow the docs advice, get the test again, and then make a decision. They can also take out one side with the hurthle cells and test it in the lab, that may give you the answer, too.

question: i recently had fna biopsies done on two nodules on my thyroid.  they are doing another one in 4 weeks because the results were inconclusive.right homogenous nodule, 7mm, lower inferior:rare thyroid follicle cells with hurthle cell features, blood, scant colloid.comment:  hypocellularity precludes definitive classification.  nonetheless, the presence of thyroid follicle cells with Hurthle cell change raises the possibility of a hurthle cell neoplasm.  a repeat fna is suggested to further characterize this nodule.left nodule, 8mm, with calcification, mid medial:negative for malignant cells -- no definitive thyroid follicle cells present.comment:  this specimen consists of blood predominatly.  some possible colloid is noted.   hypocellularity precludes classifcation.  if clinically indicated, the recommendation is a repeat fna.NOTES:  i lived near three mile island nuclear plant at the time of the accident in 1979.  my mom has graves disease and was treated with radiation a few years after that accident.i am currently on synthroid (.25).i also have Ehlers Danlos Syndrome type 3, diabetes type 2, high cholesterol & high triglycerides (responding to Lipitor, just changed to Pravastatin), Sarcoidosis (multi-system involvement), adenomyosis/endometriosis on uterine and being followed by a urologist after surgical intervention of a 15 lb tumor wrapped around my ureter.my endo warns that he may still send me to a surgeon after the 2nd fna, depending on the results.  with the TMI history, he wants to be "aggressive" in treatment.  any suggestions? further tests needed?
